intro: Caperonia neglecta, commonly known as the small white bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Caperonia neglecta is often found in shaded environments and is relatively easy to cultivate in garden settings.
